definition: clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
magnificent carriage and precious horses (idiom); rich family with extravagant lifestyle/ostentatious display of luxury
to live off the fat of the land (idiom)/to have a luxurious lifestyle
lit. stout horses and light furs/fig. to live in luxury
family of a functionary (i.e. educated middle class in Qing times)
lit. to use a sacred tripod as cooking pot and jade as ordinary stone (idiom); fig. a waste of precious material/casting pearls before swine
